attributes.action: Organise a Great Exhibition
attributes.background: Trade Delegations from all over the World coming to see what Britain has to offer in all its diversity. Every aspect of Britain and British Life can be represented, and as well as the trade Deals we can make, think of the tremendous impact on Tourism from people coming from all over the World.
attributes.additional_details:
Those Britons who worked so hard on our behalf for the Olympics as Ambassadors can welcome overseas visitors, show people around and generally be involved. 
British Royalty is revered and respected all over the World, and they can take part as did Prince Albert for the 1851 Exhibition.
We can find a way for every person in the UK to have a personal investment in this project, engendering a feeling of pride and ownership in Project Great Britain.

attributes.action: Change the law for drink driving limit to zero and an instant ban
attributes.background:
Far to many innocent people are killed every year by drink drivers. 
It's time a stop is put to it by ways of zero tolerance and instant bans being handed out for any who fail a road side breath test.

attributes.action: Put pressure on Asian governments to stop the inhumane act of shark finning.
attributes.background: Shark numbers are declining due to shark finning - this is when a live shark is taken out of the ocean to have its fin cut off and then thrown back into the water. A shark needs its fin to swim and ultimately to survive. Without it the shark soon dies as it can no longer fend for itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year an estimated 100-200 million sharks are caught for their fins, which often go into the Asian delicacy 'fin soup'. Sharks have been populating our oceans since before the dinosaurs and we can't lose them now. Sharks also play a crucial role in the ecosystem of the ocean by eating sick and dead animals and keeping the seas healthy. By saving sharks we save the oceans and the planet. Shark finning has no place in our modern world and must stop before we lose this ancient species forever.

attributes.action: Cost to be cut in family courts.
attributes.background: During court processing through the family court over residency of child/ren between an applicant father and the respondent mother. If Cafcass orders a section 7 report and these findings prove the mother has abused her child/ren, cost should be cut for the fathers, to help protect their children.
attributes.additional_details: To many fathers these days have to apply to the family court to either receive some sort of access to their children, or in worse cases to try protect their children from abuse from the mothers. If mothers are found to be abusing their children in anyway and the fathers are to be awarded full residency of the child/ren then they should receive some sort of legal aid or cut the cost of the fees. It's wrong that anyone should have to pay thousands of pounds to save or protect a child/ren

attributes.action: Make all care homes/care providers not for profit organisations
attributes.background: After many documentaries about undignified/unsafe  inadequate care homes, we need to do something. Most homes/services are understaffed under trained and underpaid due to the owners/providers wanting high profits. And the people that suffer are the residents/clients.
attributes.additional_details:
Panorama documentaries 
Cqc reports 
I have personally worked in care for many years and have experiences the poor quality first hand. It's about the time the government does something about it.

attributes.action: Ban Sodium Fluoride from our tap water
attributes.background: Sodium Fluoride is not natural, it is man made. Do not get this mixed up with calcium fluoride which is natural and can be found in soil. Sodium fluoride has not been scientificly tested for long term affects or if it even helps prevent tooth decay like we get told it does.
attributes.additional_details: Fluoride has been seen to cause alot of diseases such as cancer. https://fluoridealert.org/issues/health/ check it out for yourselves via the link above. Sodium fluoride is mostly found in the pineal gland after being indigested, which leads to a lowered IQ of the person consuming it. Unfortunately, the damaged caused by sodium fluoride can not be reversed. However we can stop making it worse and avoid the affects by stopping drinking it everyday in our tap water.

attributes.action: Scrap fees for renunciation of all types of British nationalities.
attributes.background: British nationals who want to retain EU citizenship, because they live abroad or have direct links with other EU states, some will be forced to give up their British citizenship as some EU countries don't allow dual nationality. This is a hurtful decision and the UK must not take money away from us.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fees-for-citizenship-applications

attributes.action: Raise awareness and put more funding into treating and diagnosing VGM.
attributes.background: My little boy was repeatedly failed by numerous of consultants, doctors and hospitals after being diagnosed with Vein of Galen malformation. This was purely due to the lack of knowledge and understanding of the condition. We're counting our lucky stars he finally got treatment before it was too late
attributes.additional_details:
This condition is deadly. A ticking time bomb in your head. It's diagnosed in pregnancy and is where a mass forms in the brain putting strain on the heart to provide this mass with more blood. So many children die because either because it's too late to treat them or because of complications. 
This needs to stop! 
I nearly lost my little boy and I won't sit and watch it happen to any other parent. 
Money needs to be invested in helping doctors diagnose and treat children before it's too late.

attributes.action: Guarantee rights of UK Nationals resident in other EU states will not change.
attributes.background: As a matter of urgency we call upon the UK government to unambiguously commit to guarantee any ‘Brexit deal’ will ensure all rights currently enjoyed by UK nationals resident in other EU states prior to the triggering of article 50 will remain unchanged.
attributes.additional_details: According to UN estimates 1.2 million UK Citizens have exercised their right as EU citizens to move permanently to other EU states. In many cases, if not most, entire lives are now in adoptive countries. Businesses have been opened, property has been purchased, children have been enrolled in local schools. Many such individuals were denied a voice in the Brexit vote due residency status abroad and / or errors of the electoral committee.

attributes.action: Review cases of women needing breast reduction on medical grounds, not cosmetic
attributes.background:
Many women are being refused breast reduction on NHS because it is primarily seen as cosmetic. Funding has been withdrawn in many areas of the UK. 
Many of these women are suffering long term health problems and being denied treatment that would lead to a better quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
Cosmetic surgery is performed to enhance the patients appearance and this type of surgery obviously has its place. 
However, many women are being refused breast reduction on the basis that it is, primarily, acknowledged as a cosmetic procedure. 
Women are suffering chronic backache, which at times can prove crippling, neck pain, shoulder pain, headaches and breast abscesses, to name but a few ailments. 
Referrals to a surgeon are difficult, if not impossible in some areas, due to lack of funding

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: To cease Brexit negotiations until there is a drop in racially motivated crimes.
attributes.background: Racially motivated crimes appear to have increased in this country. The Government need to halt all Brexit negotiations until there is a substantial drop in racial and xenophobic hate crimes and issue an immediate statement of 'zero tolerance'

attributes.action: Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.background:
This year marks 34 years since the Falklands War. 
The invasion of the Falkland Islands occurred April 2 1982. 
The conflict ended June 14 1982. 
We believe that to mark our Armed Forces bravery and sacrifice, this date should be known as Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the Government should mark the liberation of the Falkland Islands and name June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.
To mark our brave Armed Forces' bravery, courage and sacrifice, we believe  this should be officially recognised.
The Falklands Islands mark Margaret Thatcher Day every year. They have the right to self determination.
It is now time to mark this in our own calendar.
Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.

attributes.action: Stop the use of the honours system being used for political gain
attributes.background: All honours to be authorised only via an independent political free board. All members of the board must be free of any political party and any person who has held political office or served in a government department to be barred from holding office on this board
attributes.additional_details: Any person is permitted to put a person forward for any honour . In doing so they must state why they believe such person deserves this award.

attributes.action: Revise self defence laws in the UK and bring back handgun ownership.
attributes.background: Enough people are dead in Europe and the time to act is upon us. GCHQ has done an amazing job at preventing terror attacks in the UK but the police cannot possibly act fast enough to save us all in case of attack by terror groups. We propose a government measure to allow civilians to keep handguns.
attributes.additional_details:
The five or six consecutive terror attacks in Europe prior to this date.

The brave US police officer who fought with the Orlando shooter to delay his spree and save hundreds.

A Switzerland style gun law attitude or Israel style will work. People in Europe are applying for gun permits in droves and can only use those guns to defend themselves at home and left defenceless in the streets.

attributes.action: PM table economic review & articulate parameters Brexit not in National Interest
attributes.background:
For strong leadership in this time of uncertainty, UK citizens demand Prime Minister to immediately table an economic review of unintended consequences of vote to leave EU

It is in national interest for PM to articulate economic parameters of unemployment & growth where Brexit will not be Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
Mark Carney Governor Bank of England has articulated likelihood of lower economic growth due to Brexit

Forecast group EY Item Club says business investment & consumer spending will be held back because of uncertainty

Low-cost travel group has gone into administration as direct result of Brexit. How many more organisations will be impacted directly by Brexit cost of jobs & growth?

Lower future economic growth will impact government tax revenues & therefore forecasts of government debt

attributes.action: more support for parents with mental health, stop removing children
attributes.background: I have borderline personality disorder and because of a relapse and time in hospital, I had my children removed and placed in care. This was meant to be until I got better but they are still not home despite a return to good health and the children begging to be back. I am now fighting for them
attributes.additional_details: Too many children are removed based on a parent having mental health problems. I had mine taken despite social services saying I was a good mum and commending me on my parenting. All assessments have been positive but the psychological report paints a bad picture of people with mental health. How is removing children unless they were physically or sexually abused, benefitting children and their parents? More support in the home is needed for those that can be a good parent with help.

attributes.action: Impose a tuition fee cap for international students
attributes.background: The fees for Home/EU students are controlled by the UK Government; however, there isn't a cap for the international students. Institutions may charge international students up to 3 times the Home/EU fees. In addition, institutions may continue to raise the tuition fees. This should be capped.

attributes.action: Stop Immigration Skills Surcharge for the sake of our UK healthcare system
attributes.background: The Home Office are planning to charge £1000 per worker, per year to every employer who recruits an overseas worker. Our healthcare system is in crisis and with additional financial constraints such as this surcharge will see our healthcare system in even more trouble.
attributes.additional_details: As a country we are thousands of nurses short. The cost of overseas recruitment of highly skilled nurses is already a huge cost to our NHS and private sector. Additional surcharges will hinder the affordability of recruiting desperately needed staff. The Government have suggested this will aid UK employers to train and recruit british staff. Students are not choosing nursing as a career path due to many factors. Without highly skilled nurses, lives are increasingly at risk!

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy drinks to children under 18
attributes.background: The World Health Organisation carried out a review of the literature surrounding energy drinks & found most of potential health risks are related to the caffeine content. In Sweden they are restricted to being sold in pharmacies & are not sold to under 15's.
attributes.additional_details: This information came from NHS choices 2014 (warnings issued over energy drinks) They are likely to become a serious public health issue in the future if they are not more heavily regulated.

attributes.action: Free childcare for parents who want to return to work , child is 4 months +
attributes.background: I think parents who want to return to work and can't afford childcare should have free childcare provided or help with at least 30 hours a week.
attributes.additional_details: Childcare can be expensive and many parents find working a full week only pays childcare fees, this leeds to many parents quitting jobs to try and save some money.

attributes.action: Review decision-making process behind closure of nightclubs in the UK.
attributes.background: Following Islington Council's decision last night (6th September) not to renew the license for Fabric, an iconic dance music venue in London, we request that parliament reviews why decisions like this one and others are consistently being made to the detriment of dance and youth music culture.
attributes.additional_details: Fabric holds global significance for dance music, launching the careers of many artists and drawing crowds from all over world. In the last three months several other venues including The Arches, Passing Clouds and Dance Tunnel have also been forced to close. Dance music is an important part of music culture; the closure of places that grow the community, foster innovation and provide a venue to enjoy this music, will lead to the loss of the UK’s status of a breeding ground for musical talent.

attributes.action: Stop paying non uk citizens any benifits
attributes.background: If we stop paying benifits. Some migrants will leave of there own accord. Some might stop trying to come to the UK

attributes.action: Video all pip and esa assessments
attributes.background: There seems to be so many stories that atos, capita and other assessment companies are causing benefits to be stopped because of their lies... if they are video recorded then each party is completely backed up

attributes.action: Have a referendum on term time leave from school for families, and not be fined
attributes.background: Many working families either cannot afford school holiday prices or parents cannot get time off work during the school holidays. Families feel that we are being penalised by being threatened with fines or prison and that children are missing out quality family time.
attributes.additional_details: By having this referendum it will give families hope that the government is listening to families and understand there frustrations, school is very important to a child's future but so is the opportunity of spending really quality time with there family once a year for a one week or two week break.

attributes.action: Support Peoples QE. Reduce private debts, boost savings, rescue the economy.
attributes.background: Public and Private Debts are at an all time high in the United Kingdom.  net unsecured borrowing on credit cards and loans will rise to £662bn by the end of the decade, from £447bn in 2016. The amount of private debt is crippling the economy. We need to reduce debt in the economy.
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing that we reduce private debt through Bond given to all UK Citizens. The bond would be financed throuh QE  money created by the Bank of England. This financial value of the bond ( sat £1000 per person) would be used to either clear existing debts ( as specified) or as a savings bond for people without debt. The policy would reduce debt, increase savings, compensate savers for low interest rates reduce poverty, and help the economy to grow.

attributes.action: GAIN 'CONSUMER RIGHTS' REGARDING 'OVER PHONE' CONTRACTS FOR SMALL BUSINESSES.
attributes.background: l purchased a small pub 2 years ago to save from closure. When agreeing a Sports package over the phone I realised the next day this was not what I required. After immediate calls, letter and emails I was told I have no 14 day cooling off period, I could not cancel, and had to pay for a full year.
attributes.additional_details: Small businesses do not have the infrastructure of large companies and cannot have resources to cover all areas for contracts, accountancy, and legal complications. Specifically regarding contracts agreed over the phone where the seller could not possibly deliver all the rules and regulations of a contract, there should be 14 days allowed to consider an agreement in full. Presently an 'over the phone agreement' is irreversible and binding. Equivalence of consumer rights for Small Businesses.

attributes.action: Improve CAMHS services in Cumbria, especially surrounding eating disorders.
attributes.background: There is a huge lack of resources and staff within Cumbria CAMHS, having just one dietitician in the entire county. The team regularly allows patients suffering from eating disorders to get so severe they require inpatient treatment hundreds of miles away.There are no specialists and a lack of care.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS stands for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, and this is where children and teenagers up to the age of 18 get support and therapy for their mental illnesses. 
There are NO specialist eating disorder services within the whole county; the closest being Middlesborough, which I am currently staying as an inpatient with severe Anorexia Nervosa for the second time due to the immense lack of support and understanding in Cumbria. This is a 2 and a half hour journey. 
This is not fair.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wages for 17-20 year olds.
attributes.background: National minimum wage for 17-20 year old's should be increased, wages they receive are not just. Being a 20 year old earning £5.50 p/h is inadequate, knowing how much effort and sacrifice you put into working alongside studying. Yet we are liable for paying adult fares on public transport.

attributes.action: Shouting Racist when it is not to be charged for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.background: People who shout RACIST and point the finger when it is not are causing major hate and divisions in the UK and should be imprisoned for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.additional_details:
Everyday online and in the media we hear of RACISM when it is not. We see Labour Councillors and MPs crying Racist when people are just trying to express how they feel.

This shouting of Racism takes the light off real Racist and Racism and the people of the UK are now starting to forget real racist attacks as they are ''FED UP'' with being branded a racist when they are not.

attributes.action: Ensure UK-EU Brexit deal retains our "passporting" rights in financial services
attributes.background: If we lose passporting rights in financial services due to Brexit it could be very damaging for the UK economy as firms re-locate activities to financial centres in the EU; this key issue has been largely ignored by politicians and this petition gives citizens a voice to help protect our economy

attributes.action: Stop all DWP benefit payment sanctions immediately.
attributes.background:
It is basically unethical and unhealthy.
The UN agree - It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in B
attributes.additional_details:
THE United Nations committee on economic and cultural rights recently published a highly damning report.
It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in Britain.
The report considers a number of areas, all of which are drastically important to our everyday lives. . . . 
 foodbanks, unemployment rates, the housing crisis, mental health care and discrimination against migrants and disabled people.

attributes.action: Government to condemn the USA police forces for killing innocent Black citizens
attributes.background: Statistics show that on average around 30 African American citizens in America are killed by law enforcement officers each month.  This is unacceptable in a civilized society.  The UK is America's closest alley and so should be able to speak up and ask that America takes measures to stop this issue.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_in_the_United_States

attributes.action: Review and Change the Assesment process for PIP & ESA
attributes.background: Due to the unprecedented amount of Personal Independent Payment (PIP) and Employment Support Allowance (ESA) claims that are being overturned at Mandatory Reconsideration (MR) and Tribunal, we  demand that the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP), review and change the assessment system.
attributes.additional_details:
1.To stop using Atos/Capita assessors
2.All initial assessments to be carried out by the claimants local GP 
3.ALL assessors to be medically competent with the conditions they are assessing
4.ALL assessment’s to be recorded as a matter of course
6.Copies of all assessment reports to be sent to claimants 
7.Assessors to be penalised if reports untruthful
8.If a claimant goes through the process and awarded by the Court of Tribunal. The DWP should not withhold payment because of appeal.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to park a motor vehicle on a public footpath.
attributes.background: Vehicles obstructing the public footpath, are breaking the law, to enable a vehicle to park in such a way, the vehicle has driven to its position, driving on the footpath is illegal. Pedestrians on many occasions have to walk into traffic to pass these vehicles obstructing the footpath.
attributes.additional_details: Section 34(1) of the Road Traffic Act 1988 (RTA 1988) provides that anyone driving a mechanically propelled vehicle, for example a motor car, on a road that is a footpath, bridleway or restricted byway is guilty of an offence unless it can be shown that there is a private right in place for people to use the accessway to gain vehicular access to their property. The burden of proving that there is such a vehicular right of way in place rests with the defendant.

attributes.action: Set up Brexit commission to advise on implications before Article 50 invoked
attributes.background: In the referendum campaign voters asked for the facts but with no historic precedent this left politicians free to say anything to secure votes.  The implications are now much clearer with some known facts to draw on. An independent commission will provide impartial advice before invoking Article 50

attributes.action: Reform the law on the defence of Insanity to benefit the mentally ill
attributes.background:
The Law Commission Report in 2013 recommended a new defence with a special verdict of "not criminally responsible by reason of a recognised medical condition".
Unfortunately this slipped through government policy making and has been ignored since.
attributes.additional_details:
The current law on insanity was made in 1848 when psychaitric illness was hardly understood. 
Despite huge developments in understanding, diagnosis  and treating mental illness, the M'Naughten Rules on insanity have remained unchanged. 
Reintroducing the proposed reform by the Law Commission would mean that people with actual medical conditions won't be excluded by the law and will stop the mentally/physically ill from pleading guilty to avoid the stigma of being classed as insane.

attributes.action: All HGVs and PCVs on british roads to have driver monitoring technology
attributes.background: Distraction such as mobile phone usage or 'micro sleeping' are major contributing factors to many deaths on British roads. Result can be much worse when in control of a HGV or PCV. Legislation to ensure that these class' of vehicle are fitted with the driver monitoring technology will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-10-31/lorry-driver-who-killed-mother-and-three-children-while-on-mobile-phone-sentenced-for-10-years/

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/aug/04/lorry-driver-danny-warby-found-guilty-crash-death-sharon-garrett-cambridgeshire

http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/drivers/fatigue/road-accidents/

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/tiredness-can-kill-advice-for-drivers


http://www.brake.org.uk/wake-up/15-facts-a-resources/facts/485-driver-tiredness

attributes.action: Ban FRACKING in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Fracking leads to devastating consequences for the environment. 
It contaminates groundwater with the use of toxic chemicals, contaminates the land, can cause earthquakes!
attributes.additional_details: Science!!!

attributes.action: more funding for paediatric cardiac teaching more complex /rare heart conditions
attributes.background: My daughter aged 6months died in hospital due to post op complications. She had ebsteins anomaly a rare heart condition.  Doctors in the UK don't know much about this condition and struggle to help fix/ and or treat accordingly.

attributes.action: Make statutory holiday entitlement 26 days plus bank holidays
attributes.background: Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking that the government raise statutory holiday entitlement to 26 days per year plus bank holidays (34 total) to enable working parents to cover childcare during school holidays. The legal entitlement at present is 28 days and employers can choose to have 8 of those as bank holidays.
Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.

attributes.action: Require all local councils in England to use LED bulbs in street lights.
attributes.background: Sodium lighting is commonplace in British towns and cities. These orange lights cause a large amount of light pollution and make it difficult for most of us to see a full starry sky [1]. A switch to Amber LED lighting would improve these conditions greatly and would also be more energy efficient [2]
attributes.additional_details:
1. http://nightblight.cpre.org.uk/maps/ - The light pollution map for the UK 
2. http://www1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/publications/pdfs/alliances/outdoor_area_lighting.pdf - The American "Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy'"s report on new LED installation. 
- On the topic of Amber LED: In this case amber is the suggested colour as dimming the LEDs is the key in reducing light pollution emmisions, it also reduces blue-light exposure. http://darksky.org/lighting/led-practical-guide/

attributes.action: Any future referendum vote on Scottish Independence must be given to all the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is exactly that..United.  As part of a legal union Scotland should NOT be able to decide alone on independence as the consequences will affect ALL of the UK economically and politically.

attributes.action: Build new runways at Heathrow and Gatwick to future proof UK airport capacity
attributes.background: Heathrow often runs at 98% capcity, and is the busiest two runway airport in the world.  Likewise Gatwick is the busiest single runway airport in the world.  The capacity is long overdue, and planes are circling both hubs emitting more CO2 than necessary. Build both runways as soon as possible.
attributes.additional_details:
Gatwick has the world's busiest single-use runway. It does have two runways on site but the close proximity of the two and the length and lack of guidance for the second means that only one is used. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World%27s_busiest_airport#Busiest_airports
The plan to expand Heathrow was supported by businesses, the aviation industry, the British Chambers of Commerce, the Confederation of British Industry, the Trades Union Congress and the then Labour government. 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heathrow_Airport
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-37566361

attributes.action: Gain funding, raise awareness&reintroduce oral health education back into the UK
attributes.background: I have created this petition to gain support in introducing Oral Health Education back into the UK. As a dental nurse working in the UK I witness the daily effects&trauma that tooth decay in children under the age of 18 causes. I would like to reintroduce OHE into: nurseries,schools&the community.
attributes.additional_details:
Facts and figures:
+ More than 128,000 children under 10 had at least 1 tooth removed since 2011-2016

+ Hospitals are at 'crisis point' for children needing teeth extracted under general anaesthetic

+ £30 million spent on hospital based extractions between 2012-2013 on those aged 18 and under

+ 90% of tooth decay was preventable

+ Dental treatment is FREE for those aged under 18

attributes.action: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens.
attributes.background: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens. This will allow more students to have the opportunity to get a degree and be able to apply for the best jobs.

attributes.action: Strengthen Laws against Negligent Private Surgeons & Healthcare Providers
attributes.background:
Private healthcare patients are commonly led to believe that the care they are paying for will meet the highest standards. 
In cases where patients receive wrongful or negligent treatment  private healthcare patients have less access to adequate redress and compensation than NHS patients.
attributes.additional_details:
At present legislation is so insufficient that one private healthcare company actually stated in a legal defence document that they were ‘under no obligation to provide competent surgeons to perform surgery at the hospital’ and had ‘no duty to protect patients from harm, and risk of injury’.

We ask Secretary of State for Health, Jeremy Hunt  to close the legal loophole which allows for private healthcare patients to be left without protection or redress when things go wrong.

attributes.action: Make UK pet stores ban all pet products made in China
attributes.background: There are cases every single day of dogs and cats dying horrific deaths due to the chemicals and processes used to produce pet products in China. Their relentless disregard for pet health makes them unfit to produce these products and it's time the UK pet stores ban all China-made products.

attributes.action: Please start funding pet cemeteries like other country's.
attributes.background: I think we can all agree that our pets are more than just pets, they become best friends and family members. it is only because of my dog that I can leave my house due to my mental health. He is my bet friend and I think others will agree we need a place to rest them just like we do with people.
attributes.additional_details: As a lot of us see them as more than pets, we should have places where we can bury them and let them rest in piece. They are loved ones and should be treated as such. They don't ask for a lot in life, all they ask for is love and care and don't we all just want love? If you look after your animal, they will look after you. Please consider this as I can assure you, many, many people will really appreciate being able to use these places. Thank you.
